text: hello
[Applause]
[Music]
I'm Jose from the AWS building and
account support team here in San Jose
Costa Rica
today I'm going to show you how to
update your account information if you
are charged the incorrect amount or type
of tax
let's get started
first let's sign in to the AWS
Management console as the root user or
as an AWS identity and access management
user with the current account and
billing permissions
note it's the best practice that you do
not use the root user account for
everyday tasks
limit the use of these credentials to
only the tasks that require you to sign
in as the root user
your root user isn't the same as an IAM
user or role with full administrator
access
AWS uses the following information to
determine how you should be taxed
e-tax registration number or TRN and the
business legal address associated with
the account
if there is no tax registration number
registered on the account AWS uses the
address of the account's default payment
method
then AWS uses the account's contact
billing address
so let me show you how to update this
information on your account
to update your tax registration number
or legal address select your account
name at the top right hand corner of
your screen
and select bill in dashboard when the
bill in cost Management console opens
then on the left side menu choose tax
settings
if you have a valid tax registration
number but it is not registered on the
account
choose manage tax registration and then
choose add
you will need to fill out the
information associated with the tax
registration number
such as the country in business legal
address
if you have already registered a tax
registration number then select the
check box next to it
choose manage tax registration and then
choose edit
the current tax details register on the
account will appear so that you can edit
the required information such as the tax
number and business legal address
when you are done select next to confirm
the changes
note that if you are the payer account
and have a valid tax registration number
the tax registration number must be
added or updated for each linked account
within the organization for the text
charges to be calculated correctly
now to update the contact billing
address on the account
select your account name again and then
choose account to go to the account
settings page
next to contact information choose edit
modify the relevant Fields such as the
address city state postal code and
Country
then choose update to save the changes
let's continue to update the billing
address associated with your payment
method
select your account name again and
choose billing dashboard
then on the left side menu go to payment
methods
you can update the default payment
method register on the account by
choosing the edit option next to it
modify the billing address information
which includes the address city state
postal code and Country fields
when information is correct choose
update
if you are exempt from U.S sales taxes
in a particular State open a case with
AWS support
to open a case for your Us sales tax
except section go to the tax settings
page again
then go to the tax exceptions tab
under us customers select your account
choose manage tax exceptions and add tax
section
complete the required information about
your tax reception and upload a copy of
your valid tax certificate
then choose submit
a case will be open with AWS account and
billing support
will review your tax exempt request and
then follow up with you to give any
updates or to ask for additional
information that might be required
note that if you receive a special
status or relief from paying taxes in
your country create a case with AWS
account and billing support in the
support center
provide any applicable tax certificates
issued by the tax authorities in your
country or a specific sections of tax
legislation that are applicable to your
organization
so now you know how to update your
account information if you are charged
the incorrect amount or type of tax
for watching and happy cloud computing
from all of us here at AWS
[Music]
[Applause]
[Music]
